website_summaries.verdict: A versatile machine that prioritizes ergonomics at a good value.
pros: Fight fatigue with an adjustable device that fits almost all heights
The rollers and abdominal pads are thickly-cushioned for a comfortable, abrasion-free workout
This Roman Chair allows the user to work hamstrings, core muscles, and lower back muscles to improve posture and ease back pain
cons: This machine is rated for a maximum of 250 pounds, which limits it somewhat

customer_reviews.title: VERY CHEAPLY MADE
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to receive this in the mail and assembled it in less than 30 min. I tried to lay down and do some hyperextensions and the chair is so "awkward". I'm 5'10'' and the bar that is supposed to support your legs wobbles way too much. It is cheaply made and a very poor design. The cushions are very cheap as well and do no provide much comfort. After assembling it in 30 min, I disassembled the unit and boxed it all up to return to the vendor.
customer_reviews.author: FL_Prime_Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Sunny Roman Chair after reading several other reviews. I have had their spin cycle for a number of years so I already have been impressed by their quality for price compared to other brands. This did not disappoint. It's lightweight, easy to assemble and is great for a home gym. I'm 6'0" 190 lbs and it seems a good size although I could see it being an even better size with someone even shorter. Bottom line, if you want something that is reasonably priced but delivers high value, look no further.
customer_reviews.author: AndrewSR

customer_reviews.title: Not the Best Built System
customer_reviews.text: You get what you paid. The middle bar doesn’t fit between the thigh rest and the foot support, but the machine/table works without it, so I can’t complain too much. However, I now have about $20 worth of unnecessary steel in my shop. Everything else is good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Irving

customer_reviews.title: Great Roman Chair
customer_reviews.text: I have owned the Marcy and CAP Roman chairs before this one and this one is my favorite. There is a support bar in the middle that is not shown on the photos. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Setup was easy and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, very easy to setup, only took me about an hour to get it all put together. Very stable and functional.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff N

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good quality
customer_reviews.text: For half the price of some of its competitors I figured I would give it a shot. I was surprised how sturdy it was. 6’ 180 pounds. Easy to put together but I feel a minor improvement could be an extra outer bracket on the support bar. I cramped down a little too hard and indented the metal just slightly. My mistake not the manufacturer. Happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: M. Brubaker

customer_reviews.title: Roman Chair
customer_reviews.text: Great price. A very sturdy piece of equipment. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: R. B.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality noticed upon delivery
customer_reviews.text: Multiple welding issues and bent bars. I feel so uncomfortable just upon initial impression I probably won’t even assemble, but will just return to vendor and wait for a different product to arrive.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: I’m 5’0 is perfect
customer_reviews.text: I’m 5’0 and I can perfect use it!! I’m just right there. I’m 115 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: monica

customer_reviews.title: and when it did I assembled it in like 20 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't wait for this chair to arrive, and when it did I assembled it in like 20 minutes, and immediately started my workouts! Chair is awesome, and its pretty strong! I'm 200lbs, and it easily holds my weight!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm extremely happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I'm extremely happy with this purchase. Sturdy, easy to put together, and light enough to move to wherever I need it to be. I weigh about 200 lbs, 6'3", this does exactly what I need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and well built. Super easy to put together. Definitely well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Item

product_meta.title: Sunny Health & Fitness SF-BH6503 Roman Chair
product_meta.description: Sunny Health and Fitness's SF-BH6503 Roman Chair is a versatile, comfortable, and durable addition to your core fitness routines! Designed to help you target your back, glutes, hamstrings, and abdominals, the variety of exercises you can do with the Roman Chair is endless. Execute steady, balanced, effective fitness activities with its cushioned hand grips, padded ankle rollers, and high density foam pads. At only 30lbs, this Roman Chair may be light in weight but is high in performance!
feature_bullets: Targets lower back muscles, glutes, hamstrings and abdominal muscles, improves and strengthens core stability and functionality
Padded rollers provide comfort and support for ankles during exercise
Cushioned hand grips support additional balance and control during exercise
High density foam pads provides comport and support during exercise
